channel.title: Paper Reading Club
channel.description: The papers reading club is a weekly meeting at Inform to discuss a paper, or blogs, or whitepapers.

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.

item.title: Facebook Prophet
item.description:
Introduction

We’re finally doing the paper from Facebook.

Facebook released a paper last month about creating forecasting services at scale.

Abstract:

There are a variety of challenges that come with producing a large number of forecasts across a variety time series. Our approach to forecasting at scale is a combination of configurable models and thorough analyst-in-the-loop performance analysis. We present a forecasting approach based on a decomposable model with interpretable parameters that can be intuitively adjusted by the analyst. We describe performance analysis that we use compare and evaluate forecasting procedures, as well as automatically flag forecasts for manual review and adjustment. Tools that help analysts to use their expertise most effectively enable reliable forecasting of a large variety of business time series.

Paper and Resources

  • Paper
  • Prophet

Notes

TBA

item.title: Streaming Media Expo
item.description:
Introduction

This week’s paper is the sourcebook for Streaming Media Expo 2016.

Because there’s a ton of videos, this is my proposal: read only one article and share it with the rest of us.

Here’s your choices:

  • The State of Media and Entertainment By Troy Dreier
  • State of Enterprise Video By Tim Siglin
  • The State of Live Video By Troy Dreier
  • The State of Mobile Video By Paul Schmutzler and Tim Siglin
  • The State of Education Video By Paul Riismandel
  • The State of MPEG-DASH By Nicolas Weil
  • The State of Video Codecs By Jan Ozer
  • Streamticker By Tim Siglin

Paper and Resources

  • Event

Notes

TBA

item.title: Predicting Points and Valuing Decisions in Real Time with NBA Optical Tracking Data
item.description:
Introduction

The Warriors are at a 50/9 win/loss ratio. That means we should read about Sports Analytics. Ticketmaster presenting this paper entitled “Predicting Points and Valuing Decisions in Real Time with NBA Optical Tracking Data”.
